meta.disclaimer: Do not rely on openFDA to make decisions regarding medical care. While we make every effort to ensure that data is accurate, you should assume all results are unvalidated. We may limit or otherwise restrict your access to the API in line with our Terms of Service.

spl_product_data_elements: Cold Sore Fever Blister Treatment Docosanol DOCOSANOL DOCOSANOL BENZYL ALCOHOL LIGHT MINERAL OIL PROPYLENE GLYCOL WATER SUCROSE DISTEARATE SUCROSE STEARATE
indications_and_usage: Uses treats cold sores/fever blisters on the face or lips shortens healing time and duration of symptoms: • tingling, pain, burning, and/or itching
warnings: Warnings Allergy Alert This product may cause a severe allergic reaction. Symptoms may include: hives facial swelling wheezing/difficulty breathing shock rash If an allergic reaction occurs, stop use and seek medical help right away. For external use only
do_not_use: Do not use if you are allergic to any ingredient in this product
when_using: When using this product apply only to the affected areas do not use in or near the eyes avoid applying directly inside your mouth do not share this product with anyone. This may spread the infection.
stop_use: Stop use and ask a doctor if your cold sore gets worse or the cold sore is not healed within 10 days
keep_out_of_reach_of_children: Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.
dosage_and_administration: Directions adults and children 12 years or over: wash hands before and after applying cream apply to affected area on the face or lips at the first sign of cold sore/fever blister (tingle). early treatment ensures the best results rub in gently but completely use 5 times a day until healed children under 12 years: ask a doctor
spl_unclassified_section: Other information store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F) do not freeze
inactive_ingredient: Inactive ingredients benzyl alcohol, light mineral oil, propylene glycol, purified water, sucrose distearate, sucrose stearate
questions: Questions or Comments? Call 1-877-753-3935 Monday-Friday 9AM-5PM EST

DISTRIBUTED BY : RITE AID, 30 HUNTER LANE, CAMP HILL, PA 17011 www.riteaid.com

Dist. by: Wellspring Meds Airmont, NY 10952 Made in Canada
indications_and_usage: Uses treats cold sores/fever blisters on the face or lips shortens healing time and duration of symptoms: tingling, pain, burning, and/or itching
warnings: Warnings Allergy alert This product may cause a severe allergic reaction. Symptoms may include: hives facial swelling wheezing/difficulty breathing shock rash If an allergic reaction occurs, stop use and seek medical help right away. For external use only Do not use if you are allergic to any ingredient in this product When using this product apply only to affected areas do not use in or near the eyes avoid applying directly inside your mouth do not share this product with anyone. This may spread infection. Stop use and ask a doctor if your cold sore gets worse or the cold sore is not healed within 10 days Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.
do_not_use: Do not use if you are allergic to any ingredient in this product
when_using: When using this product apply only to affected areas do not use in or near the eyes avoid applying directly inside your mouth do not share this product with anyone. This may spread infection.
stop_use: Stop use and ask a doctor if your cold sore gets worse or the cold sore is not healed within 10 days
keep_out_of_reach_of_children: Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.
dosage_and_administration: Directions adults and children 12 years or over: wash hands before and after applying cream apply to affected area on face or lips at the first sign of cold sore/fever blister (tingle) early treatment ensures the best results rub in gently but completely use 5 times a day until healed children under 12 years: ask a doctor
storage_and_handling: Other information store between 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F) do not freeze
inactive_ingredient: Inactive ingredients benzyl alcohol, light mineral oil, propylene glycol, purified water, sucrose distearate and sucrose stearate

spl_product_data_elements: DOCOSANOL DOCOSANOL DOCOSANOL DOCOSANOL BENZYL ALCOHOL LIGHT MINERAL OIL PROPYLENE GLYCOL WATER SUCROSE DISTEARATE SUCROSE STEARATE
purpose: Purpose Cold sore/fever blister treatment Uses treats cold sores/fever blisters on the face or lips shortens healing time and duration of symptoms: • tingling, pain, burning, and/or itching
warnings: Warnings Allergy Alert This product may cause a severe allergic reaction. Symptoms may include: hives facial swelling wheezing/difficulty breathing shock rash If an allergic reaction occurs, stop use and seek medical help right away. For external use only Do not use if you are allergic to any ingredient in this product When using this product apply only to the affected areas do not use in or near the eyes avoid applying directly inside your mouth do not share this product with anyone. This may spread the infection. Stop use and ask a doctor if your cold sore gets worse or the cold sore is not healed within 10 days Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away. Directions adults and children 12 years or over: • wash hands before and after applying cream • apply to affected area on face or lips at the first sign of cold sore/fever blister (tingle) • early treatment ensures the best results • rub in gently but completely • use 5 times a day until healed children under 12 years: ask a doctor
other_safety_information: Other information store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F) do not freeze
inactive_ingredient: Inactive ingredient benzyl alcohol, light mineral oil, propylene glycol, purified water, sucrose distearate, sucrose stearate
questions: Questions or Comments? Call 1-866-210-9797 Monday-Friday 9AM-6PM EST

spl_product_data_elements: iShanCare COLD SORE TREATMENT COLD SORE TREATMENT TARTARIC ACID SUCROSE STEARATE PROPYLENE GLYCOL 2-STEARATE WATER DOCOSANOL DOCOSANOL
active_ingredient: Active ingredients Docosanol 10%-------------Cold sore / fever blister treatment
inactive_ingredient: Inactive Ingredients Light mineral oil, Sucrose stearate, Propylene glycol, Purified water.
purpose: Uses For the temporary relief of pain and itching associated with cold sores and fever blisters. Relieves dryness and softens cold sores and fever blisters.
warnings: Warnings Allergy Test-Apply a small amount of this cold sore product behind the ear or on the inner wrist.Check for allergic reactionssuch as itching,redness,orrash within 48hours.If any occur, discontinue use and seek medical help immediately.For external use only do not useif you are allergic to anyingredient in this product.
user_safety_warnings: When using this product apply only to affected areas, do not use in or near theeyes, avoid applying directly inside your mouth, do not share this product with anyone, this may spread infection.
stop_use: Stop use if your cold sore gets worse or the cold soreis not healed within 10 days.
ask_doctor_or_pharmacist: Ask a doctor if your cold sore gets worse or the cold soreis not healed within 10 days.
keep_out_of_reach_of_children: Keep out of reach of children If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.
dosage_and_administration: Dosage and administration Wash hands before and after applying, adults and children12 years of age and older: Apply to affected area not more than 3 to 4 times daily. Children under 12 years of age: Consult a doctor.
storage_and_handling: Other information Store a troom temperature and avoid excessive heat
indications_and_usage: Directions: Wash hands before and after applying, adults and children12 years of age and older: Apply to affected area not more than 3 to 4 times daily. Children under 12 years of age: Consult a doctor.
